The additional programs to be made available
under the grant will include more complete series, both
film and videotape, as well as more of the best programs
produced by individual public television stations throughout
the country. These range from "Critique" series now being
produced by WNDT, New York, to "Frying Pans West", produced
by KRMA, Denver, to thirteen new programs in the film series
"The Toy that Grew Up", produced by WTTW, Chicago, and many
others.
Mr. Leonard said "This grant comes at the right
time. We will now be able to keep up the momentum we had
built in our first three years of operation. This will help
us subtantially to keep expanding our library of 1,000 programs,
which has provided many hours of the best kind of public
service broadcasting, including entertainment."
ETS Program Service is a major source, of programming
for the non-commercial TV stations. The series are selected
for distribution by a committee of the following station program
managers: Bruce Beale, chairman, WHYY, Philadelphia; Sam
Silberman, WQED, Pittsburgh; John Felton, WTHS, Miami;
C. P. Zimmerman, KUHT, Houston; Zoel Parenteau, KCSD, Kansas
City; Jack Schlaefle, KRMA, Denver, and Wayne Bundy, KNME,
Albuquerque.
(MORE)
